children.text: Easy and Flavorful Korean Spicy Braised Tofu Recipe for Meal Prep

Korean Braised Tofu is one of my favorite dishes because it is so easy to make and is full of flavor. It is also quite spicy, so if you don't like it too hot, you can reduce the amount of chili powder. It is great served with rice, making it a hearty and complete meal. I often prepare it in advance as part of my weekly meal prepping.

Preparation: To start, use extra firm or firm tofu. It is best to rinse off any slime from the tofu, which is usually still in the same packaging and liquid for a few days. Wrap the tofu in paper towels or a kitchen or dish towel and leave it to press. Use a few cans or boards to add weight. Once the excess water has been drawn out, slice the tofu into 3/4 inch thick pieces.
Sauce: To make the basting liquid or sauce, combine water, rice vinegar, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, chili powder, sesame oil, garlic and the white parts of scallions or green onions.

Cooking: Heat some vegetable oil in a pan and add the tofu slices. Fry until the sides are golden brown, then flip them over to cook the other side. Use a paper towel to soak up any excess oil. Pour the basting liquid or sauce into the pan and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook until the sauce has reduced. Add the green parts of the green onions and mix.
Conclusion: Serve immediately or save for upcoming meals.
Ingredients
1 block extra firm or firm tofu
2 tablespoons rice vinegar
1 tablespoon soy sauce
2 tablespoons mirin
1 teaspoon sugar
2 teaspoons gochugar or chili powder
1 teaspoon sesame oil
1 clove garlic, minced
2 scallions or green onions, chopped
Vegetable oil
Recipe Steps
1. Wrap the tofu in paper towels and press it to remove excess water.
2. Cut the tofu into slices that are around 3-4 inches thick.
3. Heat up a pan with some vegetable oil and cook the tofu slices until the sides are golden brown. Flip to cook the other side.
4. Remove the excess oil with a paper towel and add the tofu slices back to the pan.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together the rice vinegar, soy sauce, mirin, sugar, gochugar or chili powder, sesame oil, garlic, and the white parts of the scallions or green onions.
6. Pour the mixture into the pan with the tofu and bring to a simmer. Cover and let cook for a few minutes.
7. Uncover the pan and allow the sauce to reduce.
8. Mix in the green parts of the scallions or green onions.
9. Serve immediately or store in the fridge for future meals.
